title: Personal Package for Denis O'Meally
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(helpeRs) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: RLEplot_mod — RLEplot_mod
text: plot relative log expresion sample. plot useful comparing normalization procedures groups.

title: RLEplot_mod — RLEplot_mod
code: RLEplot_mod(   data_matrix,   sample_sheet,   col_by = group,   title = NULL,   caption = NULL )

title: RLEplot_mod — RLEplot_mod
text: data_matrix log2 transformed counts, data.frame matrix sample_sheet sample_sheet object describes sample metadata col_by column name sample_sheet colour plot title title plot. Leave blank none, character string caption caption plot. Leave blank none, character string

title: RLEplot_mod — RLEplot_mod
text: ggplot object

title: RLEplot_mod — RLEplot_mod
text: Denis O'Meally

title: RLEplot_mod — RLEplot_mod
code: m <- -log2(replicate(10, rgamma(3e4, 0.1))) %>%     magrittr::set_colnames(letters[1:10]) sample_sheet <- data.frame(     sample_id = letters[1:10],     group = c(rep("A", 4), rep("B", 6)) )  RLEplot_mod(     m,     sample_sheet,     col_by = "group",     title = "Relative log expression",     caption = "Simulated data set of 10 samples in 5 groups drawn from 30000 genes" ) #> Joining, by = "sample_id"

title: Mixed pairwise association — mixed_assoc
text: Calculate pairwise association variables data-frame. particular nominal vs nominal Chi-square, numeric vs numeric Pearson correlation, nominal vs numeric ANOVA. Adapted https://stackoverflow.com//52557631/590437

title: Mixed pairwise association — mixed_assoc
text: df data.frame cor_method method use, one c("pearson", "kendall", "spearman"); (Default: spearman) adjust_cramersv_bias Use bias corrected Cramer's V described rcompanion::cramerV(); (Default: TRUE)

title: Mixed pairwise association — mixed_assoc
text: list two elements: associations data.frame  pairwise association variable assoc_matrix square matrix association scores variable, dimensions equal number variables.

text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Write rda file to data/ — write_data

title: Write an expression matrix to file — write_tpm_matrix
text: summarised_experiment SummarisedExperiment object path existing folder write , Default inst/extdata/ drop samples (columns) remove tpm minimum TPM gene kept, Default: 1 samples minimum number samples gene must present kept, Default: 5

title: Write an expression matrix to file — write_tpm_matrix
